column4: Using yppasswd <user> to change a user's password under NIS, I'm asked to supply the root password before the user's new password (I've already done sudo su - and am at a root prompt).  Given that by default, the root password on Ubuntu is scrambled, what can I do without setting a root password to make this work?
you can use sudo -i for an interactive 'root' session if you need access for a period of time.
